abstract: Reem Sahwil, Palestinian girl who burst into tears when Chancellor Angela Merkel told her she might be deported, has been granted residency permit to stay in Germany until October 2017.
lead_paragraph: The girl, a 14-year-old Palestinian, began to cry during a televised forum in July when Chancellor Angela Merkel told her that Germany could not admit everyone who wanted to live in the country.

headline.main: Germany: After a Tearful Moment, a Girl’s Permit to Stay Is Extended
headline.print_headline: Europe; Germany: After a Tearful Moment, a Girl’s Permit to Stay Is Extended

snippet: The girl, a 14-year-old Palestinian, began to cry during a televised forum in July when Chancellor Angela Merkel told her that Germany could not admit everyone who wanted to live in the country.
